definition: to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus

sentences.english: He did not want to think of the mutilated under-side of the fish.
sentences.chinese: 他不願想象魚腹下面殘缺的樣子。

sentences.english: How will your imperfect family celebrate this year?
sentences.chinese: 你殘缺的家庭會如何慶祝今年的假日呢？

sentences.english: Thanks to either manmade or natural dangers, animals often lose limbs.

sentences.english: To declare that the incompleted leaves also have the right to dance in the branches.
sentences.chinese: 向世人宣告殘缺的樹葉也有在枝頭舞蹈的權利。

sentences.english: He blanched at the sight of the mutilated corpse.

sentences.english: The text is damaged, but what remains does not imply the end of time.
sentences.chinese: 碑文已有殘缺，但剩餘部分並未有對末日的暗示。

sentences.english: Certainly, I confess that my reminiscences to mother are in pieces throughout.

sentences.english: Accordingly, should produce a tooth seasonable rehabilitate answers when the coronal is misshapen .

sentences.english: I'm here mutilating the memory of illusion which have been vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我使那消失的幻覺記憶殘缺不全。

sentences.english: Life, always with incomplete beauty, because the imperfections and poignance.
sentences.chinese: 人生，總是帶着殘缺的美，因缺憾而悽美。

sentences.english: Speak of the interest relief system; the functions of labor unions in executive departments are not comprehensive enough.
sentences.chinese: 在權益救濟制度上，行政機關的工會職能具有殘缺性。

sentences.english: Just, time passed, the rundown, going to see, have deep.

sentences.english: I asked Buddha to make my handicapped child whole.
sentences.chinese: 我求佛讓我殘缺的孩子健全。

definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
